page.title: 13WHERE WE LIVE 1
page.content: I live in the London Borough of Newham which is on the east side of London and north of the river Thames. The name of my road is Alnwick Road and my home is a three bedroomed terraced house built five years ago. This house is one of many in a large housing estate. Nearby is Albert Dock Hospital, once used for treating dockers who worked in the docks opposite. Now the hospital is a centre for handicapped people. The docks, once busy with ships, are now closed. On the south side of Alnwick Road at the junction of Prince Regent's Lane there is the Galleon Club which is the only building on that side of the road. In Baxter Road at junction of the Prince of Wales Road is the Ascension Church of England Church. It has a hall which is used for dance classes.
